subject: Personal Finance
title: How Inflation Is Measured
description: A short lesson to help you apply How Inflation Is Measured.

hook.text: The government tracks the price of about 80,000 items every month to calculate inflation.

buildup.text: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) tracks a 'basket' of goods representing typical household spending.

discovery.text: The basket includes food, housing, transport, healthcare, and even haircuts and pet supplies.

twist.text: Your personal inflation rate may differ wildly. If you rent, your inflation is higher than a homeowner's.

climax.text: CPI is an average. Nobody is average. Your real inflation depends on what you actually buy.

punchline.text: Your inflation isn't the headline number.

quiz.question: What does the Consumer Price Index (CPI) measure?
options: Price changes in a basket of typical goods
